Investigations focus first on urgently defining the level and cause of the myelopathy and optic neuropathy with MRI, then on confirming or refuting demyelinating disease using CSF and antibody studies while excluding structural, vascular, nutritional, and systemic inflammatory or infectious mimics, and finally on documenting optic nerve damage and treatment fitness.

investigations = ["MRI of brain and whole spine with gadolinium contrast, including dedicated sequences of the cervical spinal cord and optic nerves", "Lumbar puncture for cerebrospinal fluid cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands, IgG index, and viral PCR where indicated", "Serum aquaporin-4 (AQP4) IgG antibodies", "Serum myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein (MOG) IgG antibodies", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum vitamin B12 level", "Serum folate level", "Serum copper and ceruloplasmin", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum angiotensin-converting enzyme level", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen antibody panel", "Double-stranded DNA antibody", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies", "HIV antibody and antigen test", "Syphilis serology", "Lyme disease serology", "Visual evoked potentials", "Optical coherence tomography of the retinal nerve fiber layer", "Urine culture and sensitivity", "ECG"]
